intro: Hypoestes bosseri, commonly known as the "Snowflake Plant," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bi-colored leaves that range from white to pink and green. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, which bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Hypoestes bosseri is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and ease of care.
